rbac_patch:
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: over-perm
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources: ["pods", "pods/log", "services", "endpoints"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
- apiGroups: ["apps"]
  resources: ["deployments", "replicasets"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
podsec_patch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: ReplicaSet
metadata:
  name: nginx-79d94c948b
  namespace: demo
spec:
  template:
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsUser: 1000
          runAsGroup: 1000
      securityContext:
        seccompProfile:
          type: RuntimeDefault
summary: The ClusterRole 'over-perm' grants excessive permissions. It has been restricted to get/list/watch pods, services, endpoints, deployments, and replicasets. The pod's security context has been hardened to align with Pod Security Standards (restricted profile): privilege escalation is disabled, capabilities are dropped, the root filesystem is read-only, and a non-root user/group is specified, and seccomp profile is set to RuntimeDefault.
